medical_history.chief_complaint: Vague abdominal pain, anorexia, and intermittent nausea.
medical_history.history_of_present_illness: Symptoms began 6 days ago with vague abdominal pain, anorexia, and intermittent nausea. The pain gradually localized to the right lower quadrant (RLQ) and improved somewhat 2 days ago, but since then has worsened again. No fevers or chills noted, continues to have no appetite, and has had some intermittent diarrhea. No emesis reported, though able to take food and liquids which exacerbate the pain.
medical_history.family_history: Both parents with hypertension and diabetes mellitus. Father has a history of prostate cancer, mother has a history of stomach cancer.
